mdl-eyelink: Bindings for Eyelink and Python.Â¶

mdl-eyelink provides a high-level interface for eyetracking research in Python. This package was created at the Institute for Mental Health Research, at the University of Texas at Austin by Semeon Risom.

For a brief introduction to the ideas behind the library, you can read the introduction. Visit the installation page to see how you can download the package. You can browse the example to see what you can do with this package, and then check out the tutorial and API reference to find out how.

To see the code or report a bug, please visit the github repository.

Features

  • Relational: API | Tutorial
  • eyetracking: API | Tutorial
  • calibration: API | <calibration>
  • pylink: API <pylink> | Tutorial <pylink>
